pull.title: Fix boost headers included as user instead of system headers
pull.body:
In most of the project, boost headers are included as system headers.
Fix the few inconsistent places where they aren't.

events.message:
Fix boost headers included as user instead of system headers

In most of the project, boost headers are included as system headers.
Fix the few inconsistent places where they aren't.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -827,14 +827,14 @@ TEMP_CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS"
 CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS $BOOST_CPPFLAGS"
 AC_MSG_CHECKING([for mismatched boost c++11 scoped enums])
 AC_LINK_IFELSE([AC_LANG_PROGRAM([[
-  #include "boost/config.hpp"
-  #include "boost/version.hpp"
+  #include <boost/config.hpp>
comments.body: @theuni as this is part of a check, I wonder if there was a specific resaon for using `"` instead of `<`?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -827,14 +827,14 @@ TEMP_CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS"
 CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS $BOOST_CPPFLAGS"
 AC_MSG_CHECKING([for mismatched boost c++11 scoped enums])
 AC_LINK_IFELSE([AC_LANG_PROGRAM([[
-  #include "boost/config.hpp"
-  #include "boost/version.hpp"
+  #include <boost/config.hpp>
comments.body: For reference this code came from #7302
